content:
Diagnosis:
Muscle invasive bladder cancer - nested variant urothelial carcinoma, T3aN1M0

Previous Treatment:
Cystoscopy and TURBT 15 March 2024 - incomplete resection due to extensive disease
Neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin commenced 1 April 2024, completed 2 cycles

Current Status:
Disease progression during neoadjuvant chemotherapy

MDT Discussion Points:
1. Progressive disease on imaging after 2 cycles neoadjuvant chemotherapy
2. Consideration of alternative systemic therapy given ERBB3 mutation
3. Surgical options in context of progression

Recent Investigations:
CT urogram 28 April 2024 shows increase in bladder wall thickening from 1.8cm to 2.4cm with new left pelvic sidewall lymphadenopathy. Previously noted right external iliac nodes stable at 1.2cm.

Blood results show deteriorating renal function with creatinine 156 (baseline 98)

MDT Outcome:
The case was discussed at the Uro-oncology MDT on 2 May 2024 with input from urology, medical oncology, clinical oncology, and radiology. Given the progression on first-line chemotherapy and presence of ERBB3 mutation, the consensus recommendation is for:

1. Discontinuation of gemcitabine/cisplatin
2. Referral to phase I unit for consideration of ERBB3-targeted therapy
3. If trial therapy not available, to commence second-line pembrolizumab
4. Defer radical cystectomy until response to systemic therapy assessed

Current Issues:
Patient experiencing increasing lower abdominal pain and frank hematuria requiring regular opioid analgesia. Performance status remains 1.

Plan:
1. Urgent referral to phase I unit
2. CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 6 weeks
3. Weekly review of renal function
4. Urology review for consideration of palliative TURBT if symptoms worsen
5. Review in combined clinic with trial team in 2 weeks
